text: (upbeat music)

- Hi, I'm Sounil Yu, creator
of the Cyber Defense Matrix.

Many consider identity
to be the new parameter

and this is particularly
true in the cloud.

Access to resources in
AWS are largely determined

based on identity, not
on physical location
or network locality.
This is a paradigm shift that requires

the right set of tools
for lifecycle management
and protection of these identities

and their associated entitlements
for access to resources.

This management also
includes the proper handling

of privileged access and
specifically administrative
or root level access.

In AWS Marketplace,
you'll find capabilities

that help with privileged
access management,

including discovery of
highly privileged accounts,

access reviews, multifactor
authentication enforcement,
just-in-time access provisioning,
and revocation of unnecessary privileges.

AWS Marketplace also offers
third party solutions

to assist with managing secrets,
API keys, and credentials,

helping to ensure that these
are properly safeguarded
and accessible by only the entities
that are authorized to obtain them.
Lastly, it's important that these tools

seamlessly integrate with
existing identity systems

such as Active Directory or
any SAML identity provider
to support convenient features
like single sign-on.

Identity and access management
is a fundamentally important
security function within AWS.
And that's why AWS Marketplace offers many
third party solution capabilities

to help you securely govern
and control your identity
and access management needs.
